sentences.en: {"GLOSS":["spending by a company on buildings, machinery, equipment etc"],"COLLOINEXA":["capital expenditure"]}
A change in the money supply brings a corresponding change in expenditure.
sentences.cn: 货币供应量的改变随即引起支出的相应改变。

sentences.en: An expenditure for clothing will qualify as a trade or business expense.
sentences.cn: 服装费将可算作贸易或商务开支。

sentences.en: Capital expenditure can be financed by borrowing; operating expenditure should not.
sentences.cn: 资本支出可以靠借款, 而运营费用不行.

sentences.en: Expenditure this year should be just under 15 billion pounds.
sentences.cn: 今年的支出应正好低于150亿英镑。

sentences.en: He balanced his budgets by rigid control over public expenditure.
sentences.cn: 他通过严格控制公共开支保持预算平衡。

sentences.en: I'm getting short of money. I have to draw in my expenditure.
sentences.cn: 我缺钱, 得节省开支.

sentences.en: It is questionable whether the expenditure on this project is really justified.
sentences.cn: 该项目的开支是否真的合理还未可知。

sentences.en: Public expenditure on the arts is woefully inadequate.
sentences.cn: 艺术方面的公共支出严重不足。

sentences.en: the expenditure of time and money on your house or garden
sentences.cn: 你在房子或花园上所花费的时间和金钱

sentences.en: The rise in interest rates acted as a brake on expenditure.
sentences.cn: 利率的提高产生了抑制消费的作用.

sentences.en: There have been cries of outrage about this expenditure.
sentences.cn: 这项开支遭到了一些人愤怒的指责。

sentences.en: They will be concerned to cut back expenditure on unnecessary items.
sentences.cn: 他们将会考虑削减不必要的开销。

sentences.en: We must cut back on expenditure in order to remain solvent.
sentences.cn: 我们应减少开支,以备急用.

sentences.en: You must ask permission for all major expenditure.
sentences.cn: 一切重大开支均须报请批准。

sentences.en: You will have to render an account of your expenditure.

words.tran_cn: 可消费的；排出的；不重复使用的；可牺牲的

phrases.tran_cn: 资本支出；基本建设费用
市政开支；公用事业费用
税式支出；税收优惠造成的财政收入减少

trans.tran_en: the total amount of money that a government, organization, or person spends during a particular period of time
